skip_file_no_year: Skipping file {filename} (no year information and include all years not set)
warning_no_bib_files: Warning: No .bib files found in {folder} folder
start_processing_papers: Starting to process relevance of {count} papers...
actual_threads_used: Actual threads used: {threads}, average per thread: {avg:.1f} papers
running_warning: Program is running, cannot change path settings!
language_changed: Language setting changed, restart program to take effect
folder_not_set_message: Please set all folder paths in the Folder Settings tab first, then start processing.
year_range_all: Current setting: Include files of all years
year_range_specific: Current setting: Only include files from {start} - {end}
add_api_keys: Please create txt files in APIKey folder and add API keys.
check_data_folder: Please check if Data folder contains .bib files.
help_content:
AutoPaperSearch User Guide

【Folder Structure】
• Data Folder: Store academic paper .bib files
  **⚠️ Important: You MUST create subfolders under Data folder to store .bib files!**
  - Correct: Store .bib files in Data/CHI/, Data/IEEEVR/ subfolders
  - Wrong: Placing .bib files directly in Data root directory (will NOT be recognized)
  - Support classification by conference, year, etc.
  - System automatically reads all .bib files in subfolders
  
• APIKey Folder: Store API key files
  - Create .txt files and add your API keys
  - **Currently only supports DeepSeek model API keys**
  - Support multiple API key files, auto-loaded
  
• Result Folder: Store screening results
  - Relevant papers saved in .bib format
  - Filenames include timestamps for management
  
• Log Folder: Store processing logs
  - Log_Result: Screening result logs
  - Log_YoN: Relevance judgment logs
  - Log_ALL: Complete processing logs

【.bib File Naming Recommendations】
• **Recommended: Include year information**
  - Suggested format: ConferenceName+Year.bib (e.g., CHI2016.bib, IEEEVR2023.bib)
  - System can filter files based on year in filename
  - Supports year range settings for improved efficiency
  
• **Other naming methods are also acceptable**
  - Names without year information (e.g., results.bib, filtered_papers.bib)
  - Suitable for secondary screening of previous results
  - These files will be processed when "Include All Years" is selected

【Year Range Settings Feature】
• Set year filtering range in the "Data Selection" tab
  - **Include All Years**: Process all .bib files (including files without year info)
  - **Specify Year Range**: Only process .bib files with years within the specified range
  - Year range settings update paper count statistics in real-time
  - Files without year information are ignored when year range is specified

【Data Selection Feature】
• In the "Data Selection" tab, you can choose which folders to process
  - **You can select one or multiple subfolders for processing**
  - Use the "Select All" checkbox to quickly select or deselect all folders
  - The interface shows real-time count of selected folders and total papers
  - If no folder is selected, the system cannot start processing

【Usage Steps】
**1. Ensure that the .bib files in the Data folder are stored in separate subfolders**
**2. Add DeepSeek API keys to APIKey folder**
**3. Fill in research question, requirements, and keywords**
**4. Click "Start Processing" to screen papers**

【Notes】
• **Do not close program during processing**
• Click "Stop Processing" to interrupt anytime
• Regularly backup important screening results
• **Current version only supports DeepSeek model**
avg_time_per_paper: Average time per paper: {time:.2f}s ({threads} threads concurrent processing)
apikey_folder_not_exist: Warning: APIKey folder does not exist: {path}
no_txt_files_found: Warning: No txt files found in APIKey folder: {path}
api_keys_loaded: Successfully loaded {keys} API keys from {files} files
no_valid_api_keys: Warning: No valid API keys loaded!
api_key_format_hint: Please ensure txt files in APIKey folder contain valid API keys (starting with 'sk-')
api_key_usage_hint: Please ensure to pass a valid api_key parameter when calling check_paper_relevance function.
unexpected_relevant_value: Warning: Model returned unexpected relevant value: {result}
missing_relevant_field: Warning: Missing relevant field in JSON response: {response}
missing_reason_field: Warning: Missing reason field in JSON response
json_parse_error: Warning: Unable to parse JSON returned by model: {error}
no_token_info: Warning: No token usage information in API response, using estimated values
data_folder_read_error: Error: Unable to read Data folder contents: {error}
data_folder_not_exist: Error: Data folder does not exist: {path}
no_clustering_words: Please generate brief summary first or input clustering keywords
generating_summary_with_keywords: Generating brief summary based on keywords...
generating_summary_auto: Auto-generating keywords and creating brief summary...
warning_insufficient_api_keys: Warning: Insufficient API keys, at least 2 API keys are required for result analysis
brief_summary_generated: Brief summary generation completed, using API: {api}..., model: deepseek-v3
keyword_based_summary_generated: Keyword-based brief summary generation completed, using API: {api}..., model: deepseek-v3
deep_summary_generated: Deep summary generation completed, using API: {api}..., model: deepseek-r1
no_bib_files_found: No .bib files found in result folder
deep_summary_stream_generated: Deep summary stream generation completed, using API: {api}..., model: deepseek-r1
error_no_analysis_api_keys: Error: No available analysis API keys
error_no_related_papers: No related papers found, cannot generate summary
error_insufficient_api_keys_deep: Error: At least 2 API keys required for deep analysis

error_no_clustering_words: Please generate brief summary first or input clustering keywords
